p: In other papers it was reported that the chitosan nanoparticles (MW of 680 kDa) exhibit higher antibacterial activity against E. coli than the corresponding microparticles obtained from the same chitosan [ 56], because of the higher surface charge [ 67] and the larger surface area of the nanosized chitosan nanoparticles, which probably tightly adsorbed onto the bacteria cells surface, disrupting the normal functions of the membrane [ 56].
